summary: The Rural Health Innovation Act of 2025 aims to improve healthcare access in rural areas. It establishes a Rural Health Center Innovation Awards program providing grants to Federally qualified health centers and rural health clinics to operate as walk-in urgent care and triage centers. It also creates a Rural Health Department Enhancement Program that awards grants to rural health departments to enhance emergency services, primary care, and triage capabilities. The bill authorizes appropriations of $25 million annually for each program from fiscal years 2026-2030.
